results.title: Balinese gong orchestra
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Keith Gow and John Morris
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: Indonesia”.
A simple explanatory film on the well-known Indonesian Gamelan Gong, using the Tunjuk Orchestra. Each instrument is explained and demonstrated, then the orchestra plays a piece from the Ramayana Ballet Suite. This was “written” in the 1950’s and is based on traditional tunes. An excellent introduction to this music, quite strange and exciting to Western ears.

results.title: Bali: the release of a soul
results.creator_credit: United Cinema, Ted Myers and John Phillips
results.brief_description: To the Balinese, life and religion are one. The film explains this as it explains some aspects of the school system, religion and village life, to the accompaniment of gamelan music.

results.title: Bali: island of magic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”.
Bali is one of the many Indonesian islands, but it differs from the other Muslim islands in that the people are mainly Hindu, with some Buddhists and an underlying interest in nature worship and even roots of ancient nature worship. Shows the daily life of the Balinese, which is governed by a voluntary village council, the farming and fishing, the market and the monkey dance. Narrated by Roger Climpson. No other credits available.

results.title: Bali: island of gods and demons
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”.
Bali, one of the many islands that make up the Indonesian nation, is a tropical paradise. Religion plays a great part in the daily life of the people and we see many fine temples and some of their religious ceremonies. Narrated by Roger Climpson. No other credits available.

results.title: Bali: A Window on Paradise
results.creator_credit: Sonoma Video Productions, Michael Heumann and Richard Yerxa
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
A comprehensive tour of the beautiful Indonesian island of Bali - its slumbering volcanoes, mountain lakes, lush green rice paddies and intricate temples. Bali, despite its dependence on tourism, still retains its vital four thousand year old culture. The video takes us to Lake Bratan; Ubud, the country’s cultural centre; Mas, famous for its carved wood masks; the port of Singaraja and the beaches of Sanur.

results.title: Bali today
results.brief_description: Illustrates life on the small volcanic island of Bali in Indonesia. Emphasises the role of the Brahmin religion in everyday life, with scenes of the rice harvest, colourful dance ceremonies, and flower offerings to the gods. Examples of weaving and mask-making illustrates Balinese art. No other credits available.

results.title: Balance of nature
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, CSIRO and S.T. Evans
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Instances of the upsetting of the balance of nature by the introduction of an animal or insect to a new environment, and the subsequent introduction of yet another animal or insect to eliminate the past. Introduced by John West.
